definition: very slight sound/rustling (onom.)/to stream down (of tears)/luxuriant growth (of vegetation)

sentences.chinese: 她眼泪扑簌簌地往下掉。

sentences.english: The leaves are rustling in the wind.
When these breezes reached the platform the palm-fronds would whisper.
sentences.chinese: 微风吹到平台时，棕榈叶片发出簌簌的低吟。

sentences.english: Her breathing was light and shallow, a little pulse throbbed in her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她的呼吸又轻又浅，脉搏在脖子里微微地簌簌跳动。

sentences.english: Did not see what kind of people, tears Susu to fall off.
sentences.chinese: 没看见那来的人，眼泪簌簌地掉下来。

sentences.english: Rustle the snow is still underground, and go find some more air.
sentences.chinese: 雪依然簌簌地下着，走了一段越发觉得空气的寒冽。

sentences.english: Hundreds of Zelkova leaves rustle in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 榉树在黑暗中摩擦着无数叶片，簌簌作响。

sentences.english: Suddenly want to leisurely swim lay in the rustle in late autumn, enjoy the warm and cool.
sentences.chinese: 突然的想悠哉游躺于簌簌声里，享受深秋的温凉。

definition: to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
to swirl in the air (of thickly falling snowflakes, flower petals etc)/to flutter about
(of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
lit. to fill the whole sky/everywhere/as far as the eye can see
(of snow etc) to fill the sky
